intro: Pinalia wildgrubeana, commonly known as the wildgrubean pinalia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in the summer. It typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as grasslands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
